result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 5/25/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

Judge Chris Taylor appeared by zoom video. Court reporter Meredith Seymour and clerk Casee Trickel appeared in person.
10:04 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count # 1, 2, 3  .

Casee T
Defn requests plea/sentencing ASAP
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
and returned.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 5/10/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DAV. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Status conference on July 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

State requests $250 cash, arugment by State. CT orders ($500) signature bond and referral to DCPS w/ GPS. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Bail/bond hearing on May 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DAV. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

02:53 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.
